Detective Chief Commissioner Jan Seidel and his colleagues from the homicide king in winter have to solve a mysterious case. In a remote cave in the Seven Mountains has found the body of a woman who was apparently killed violently. At the same time the wife of a local notary has vanished under mysterious circumstances. Actually she wanted to celebrate her birthday, but a maid finds the window of her bedroom open before - from the woman no trace. Romina Schleheck artist who lives in a haunted half-timbered house on the outskirts of King Winter, comes under scrutiny from the police. Because she is the mistress of Michael Sippmeyer, the husband of missing persons. Although it turns out soon that the dead do not Sippmeyers wife is in the cave - but now the police is facing a double mystery. To make matters worse January Seidel also has to contend with family and highly personal conflicts, which does not exactly make the difficult investigation easier. 

After numerous short stories, the two-time winner of the Friedrich-Glauser Prize has submitted her first novel with murder Nibelungen. The title of the novel Judith Merchant makes the same clear where their story is set. Much more clever than many other authors of so-called regional thrillers she builds the sagas of the Seven Mountains well in their history. Artist Romina Schleheck has been found after a creative crisis their own Siegfried. Lawyer Michael Sippmeyer described by Merchant as a genuine Beau, where the ladies just melt along. He is even more concerned about social conventions, no one should know of his extramarital relationship somewhat. Sippmeyer is the typical cowardly bourgeois who wants to enjoy the sweet fruits, without having to stand up straight. However Schleheck is an artist, how they like to imagine. Creative, with protracted crises, but must make unpopular Kitsch also for their daily bread.
